channel.title: Is it possible?
channel.description:
Well my pc is @ 3gigs ram and it's only expandable to four. I'm planning to max it out, but is it possible I can some how do something to add as much as I can? I want a good 6-8gigs the least [If I could make it so I can get 12gigs+ I wouldn't buy a new gaming's computer on Christmas just a graphics card] So is it possible I can make it so I can install 12gigs?[Or even 6-8]
I have four gigs lets say and a 4g usb on windows ready boost[which I'm not sure it does anything]. And if I can get 6-8 or even 12gigs I'd combine it with my 16gig usb
So my questions are Can I do something to exceed my ram limit? Does windows ready boost really do anything?
Off topic: Whats a good price for a 120mm cooling fan?
Thanks

item.title: Is it possible?
item.dc:creator: @933pm 933pm
item.description:
@933pm wrote:

Cannot exceed limit, that’s like the definition of the word…

Read full topic

item.title: Is it possible?
item.dc:creator: @runescape3dude runescape3dude
item.description:
@runescape3dude wrote:

According to my mobo manual, mine is limited to 4gb ram (ddr2 800) so I’m wondering if it would work with 6-8?

Read full topic

item.title: Is it possible?
item.dc:creator: @cows_be_sacred cows_be_sacred
item.description:
@cows_be_sacred wrote:

[quote=“Moparisthebest, post:20, topic:299725”][quote author=cows_be_sacred link=topic=396014.msg2942709#msg2942709 date=1252008221]

what the hell do you do with it

try running a half decent os that can manage memory

I just want it
[/quote]

It looks like you need a different motherboard (pretty much you need a new computer)[/quote]
Yeah well, I’ll just upgrade to 4 gigs. Not that big of a deal

Read full topic

item.title: Is it possible?
item.dc:creator: @RXVL RXVL
item.description:
@RXVL wrote:

I looked up your model and found this http://support.gateway.com/s/PC/R/1015482R/1015482Rnv.shtml which says you have this mobo http://support.gateway.com/s/MOTHERBD/ECS/4006278R/4006278Rsp2.shtml which says it only supports up to 4 GB of DDR2 800 RAM.

Read full topic

item.title: Is it possible?
item.dc:creator: @moparisthebest Moparisthebest
item.description:
@moparisthebest wrote:

It might have a max of 4gb, or they could have just said that if it came with a 32-bit OS. (making it a software limit, not a hardware one) You could always buy the RAM and try it out, knowing that it will probably not all be used, or you could do some more research, maybe even call gateway?

Read full topic

item.title: Is it possible?
item.dc:creator: @Starting_up Starting up ...
item.description:
@Starting_up wrote:

[quote=“cows_be_sacred, post:8, topic:299725”][quote author=sppt link=topic=396014.msg2941990#msg2941990 date=1251940004]
are you talking about 32 bits or 64 bits OS?
[/quote]
talkin 'bout 64bit vista[br][br][size=1]Posted on: September 02, 2009, 07:45:41 pm[/size][hr][quote author=Starting up … link=topic=396014.msg2942036#msg2942036 date=1251942279]

[quote author=cows_be_sacred link=topic=396014.msg2942031#msg2942031 date=1251942165]

How do you know it is only expandable to four? How many slots do you have? What kind of mobo do you have?

Can’t find the mobo

anyways I have a gateway GT5668E and I’ve read loads of specs and they all say expandable to four gigs but there are four slots so doesn’t this mean I can just replace it all with 4 2gig ram sticks?
[/quote]If you have 4 ddr slots, then I’m sure you can go past 4 gbs… Now if you have two ddr slots your max is probably 4 gbs…

Yes there’s four slots I’ve seen inside my pc anyways when I installed a gpu and psu anyways.

So why would it say expandable to four? Maybe they aren’t including 2gig ram sticks
[/quote]Something you could of included in your post was the type of ram your computer took. But I’m pretty sure that they make 2gb sticks…

I’m almost certain it’s ddr2 let me double check

Edit: yeah ddr2. Also sorry about the double post, was an accident[/quote]sigh That’s not telling me what I want to know.

My ram is Ddr2 pc3200 - That’s what I need to know

Read full topic

item.title: Is it possible?
item.dc:creator: @cows_be_sacred cows_be_sacred
item.description:
@cows_be_sacred wrote:

sppt:

are you talking about 32 bits or 64 bits OS?

talkin 'bout 64bit vista[br][br][size=1]Posted on: September 02, 2009, 07:45:41 pm[/size][hr][quote=“Starting up …, post:7, topic:299725”][quote author=cows_be_sacred link=topic=396014.msg2942031#msg2942031 date=1251942165]

[quote author=Starting up … link=topic=396014.msg2942026#msg2942026 date=1251942027]

How do you know it is only expandable to four? How many slots do you have? What kind of mobo do you have?

Can’t find the mobo

anyways I have a gateway GT5668E and I’ve read loads of specs and they all say expandable to four gigs but there are four slots so doesn’t this mean I can just replace it all with 4 2gig ram sticks?
[/quote]If you have 4 ddr slots, then I’m sure you can go past 4 gbs… Now if you have two ddr slots your max is probably 4 gbs…

Yes there’s four slots I’ve seen inside my pc anyways when I installed a gpu and psu anyways.

So why would it say expandable to four? Maybe they aren’t including 2gig ram sticks
[/quote]Something you could of included in your post was the type of ram your computer took. But I’m pretty sure that they make 2gb sticks…[/quote]
I’m almost certain it’s ddr2 let me double check

Edit: yeah ddr2. Also sorry about the double post, was an accident

Read full topic
